pullRequest.body:
If a functor `G : D â¥¤ C` between pretriangulated categories is triangulated, and if we have an adjunction `F âŠ£ G` (that commutes with the shifts), then `F` is also a triangulated functor.

We prove this from the symmetric statement (`F` triangulated implies `G` triangulated) using opposite categories.

- [ ] depends on: #20363


---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12734591693/job/35492344858)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/12734591693/job/35492344749)

The name should remain something like `commShift_op` because for a natural transformation, `CommShift` is a property (it involves no data): we should follow the naming conventions of lemmas rather than defs.

We usually append the list of authors:
```suggestion
Authors: JoÃ«l Riou, Sophie Morel
```
Here, there is data. A better name could be `commShiftFunctorOpInt`.

```suggestion
we prove that this is compatible with composition and that the identity adjunction is
triangulated.
```
I believe `Functor.isTriangulated_op` should be made an instance (or at least a scoped instance in the `Pretriangulated.Opposite` namespace).
I did something, but it breaks the symmetry between `isTriangulated_op` and `isTriangulated_of_op`.

We should not care too much about names of instances, as these defs/lemmas are supposed to be found automatically. Still, here, it would be better to name it `functor_isTriangulated_op`, because we should reserve `isTriangulated_op` for the fact that the opposite category of a triangulated category is triangulated, which I shall PR some day...

```suggestion
noncomputable scoped instance commShift_natTrans_op_int {G : C â¥¤ D} [G.CommShift â„¤] (Ï„ : F âŸ¶ G)
```

```suggestion
noncomputable scoped instance commShift_adjunction_op_int {G : D â¥¤ C} [G.CommShift â„¤] (adj : F âŠ£ G)
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Triangulated/Adjunction): the left adjoint of a triangulated functor is triangulated
